summary: The Stop Illegal Reentry Act (S. 271) aims to amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to increase penalties for non-citizens who illegally re-enter the United States after having been removed. The bill defines “removal,” outlines increased criminal penalties based on prior convictions (including misdemeanors, felonies, and aggravated felonies), and specifies mandatory minimum sentencing for certain repeat offenders.  It also addresses reentry after specific types of removal and adjusts related statutory references.
